   21: 
   22: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
   23: %%% File    : system_info_SUITE.erl
   24: %%% Author  : Rickard Green <rickard.s.green@ericsson.com>
   25: %%% Description : Misc tests of erlang:system_info/1
   26: %%%
   27: %%% Created : 15 Jul 2005 by Rickard Green <rickard.s.green@ericsson.com>
   28: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
   29: -module(system_info_SUITE).
   30: -author('rickard.s.green@ericsson.com').
   31: 
   32: %-define(line_trace, 1).
   33: 
   34: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   35: 
   36: -export([all/0, suite/0]).
   37: 
   38: -export([process_count/1, system_version/1, misc_smoke_tests/1,
   39:          heap_size/1, wordsize/1, memory/1, ets_limit/1, atom_limit/1,
   40:          procs_bug/1,
   41:          ets_count/1, atom_count/1, system_logger/1]).
   42: 
   43: -export([init/1, handle_event/2, handle_call/2]).
   44: 
   45: -export([init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   46: 
   47: suite() ->
   48:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   49:      {timetrap, {minutes, 2}}].
   50: 
   51: all() -> 
   52:     [process_count, system_version, misc_smoke_tests,
   53:      ets_count, heap_size, wordsize, memory, ets_limit, atom_limit, atom_count,
   54:      procs_bug,
   55:      system_logger].
   56: 
   57: 
   58: init_per_testcase(procs_bug, Config) ->
   59:     procs_bug(init_per_testcase, Config);
   60: init_per_testcase(_, Config) ->
   61:     Config.
   62: 
   63: end_per_testcase(procs_bug, Config) ->
   64:     procs_bug(end_per_testcase, Config);
   65: end_per_testcase(_, Config) ->
   66:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   67: 
   68: %%%
   69: %%% The test cases -------------------------------------------------------------
   70: %%%
   71: 
   72: process_count(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   73:     case catch erlang:system_info(modified_timing_level) of
   74: 	Level when is_integer(Level) ->
   75: 	    {skipped,
   76: 	     "Modified timing (level " ++ integer_to_list(Level)
   77: 	     ++ ") is enabled. spawn() is too slow for this "
   78: 	     " test when modified timing is enabled."};
   79: 	_ ->
   80: 	    process_count_test()
   81:     end.
   82: 
   83: process_count_test() ->
   84:     OldPrio = process_flag(priority, max),
   85:     check_procs(10),
   86:     check_procs(11234),
   87:     check_procs(57),
   88:     check_procs(1030),
   89:     check_procs(687),
   90:     check_procs(7923),
   91:     check_procs(5302),
   92:     check_procs(12456),
   93:     check_procs(14),
   94:     check_procs(1125),
   95:     check_procs(236),
   96:     check_procs(125),
   97:     check_procs(2346),
   98:     process_flag(priority, OldPrio),
   99:     ok.
  100:     
  101: 
  102: check_procs(N) ->
  103:     CP = length(processes()),
  104:     Procs = start_procs(N),
  105:     check_pc(CP+N),
  106:     stop_procs(Procs),
  107:     check_pc(CP).
  108: 
  109: check_pc(E) ->
  110:     P = length(processes()),
  111:     SI = erlang:system_info(process_count),
  112:     io:format("E=~p; P=~p; SI=~p~n", [E, P, SI]),
  113:     E = P,
  114:     P = SI.
  115: 
  116: start_procs(N) ->
  117:     lists:map(fun (_) ->
  118: 		      P = spawn_opt(fun () ->
  119: 					    receive after infinity -> bye end
  120: 				    end,
  121: 				    [{priority, max}]),
  122: 		      {P, erlang:monitor(process, P)}
  123: 	      end,
  124: 	      lists:seq(1, N)).
  125: 
  126: stop_procs(PMs) ->
  127:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, _}) ->
  128: 			  exit(P, boom)
  129: 		  end, PMs),
  130:     lists:foreach(fun ({P, M}) ->
  131: 			  receive {'DOWN', M, process, P, boom} -> ok end
  132: 		  end, PMs).
  133: 
  134: 
  135: system_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  136:     {comment, erlang:system_info(system_version)}.
  137: 
  138: misc_smoke_tests(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  139:     true = is_binary(erlang:system_info(info)),
  140:     true = is_binary(erlang:system_info(procs)),
  141:     true = is_binary(erlang:system_info(loaded)),
  142:     true = is_binary(erlang:system_info(dist)),
  143:     ok = try erlang:system_info({cpu_topology,erts_get_cpu_topology_error_case}), fail catch error:badarg -> ok end,
  144:     true = lists:member(erlang:system_info(tolerant_timeofday), [enabled, disabled]),
  145:     ok.
  146:     
  147: 
  148: heap_size(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  149:    {min_bin_vheap_size, VHmin} = erlang:system_info(min_bin_vheap_size),
  150:    {min_heap_size, Hmin} =  erlang:system_info(min_heap_size),
  151:    GCinf =  erlang:system_info(garbage_collection),
  152:    VHmin = proplists:get_value(min_bin_vheap_size, GCinf),
  153:    Hmin  = proplists:get_value(min_heap_size, GCinf),
  154:    ok.
  155: 
  156: %% Tests the various wordsize variants
  157: wordsize(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  158:     A = erlang:system_info(wordsize),
  159:     true = is_integer(A),
  160:     A = erlang:system_info({wordsize,internal}),
  161:     B = erlang:system_info({wordsize,external}),
  162:     true = A =< B,
  163:     case {B,A} of
  164: 	{4,4} ->
  165: 	    {comment, "True 32-bit emulator"};
  166: 	{8,8} ->
  167: 	    {comment, "True 64-bit emulator"};
  168: 	Other ->
  169: 	    exit({unexpected_wordsizes,Other})
  170:     end.
  171: 
  172: %% Verify that erlang:memory/0 and memory results in crashdump produce are similar
  173: memory(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  174:     %%
  175:     %% Verify that erlang:memory/0 and memory results in
  176:     %% crashdump produce are similar.
  177:     %%
  178:     %% erlang:memory/0 requests information from each scheduler
  179:     %% thread and puts the information together in erlang code
  180:     %% (erlang.erl).
  181:     %%
  182:     %% When a crash dump is written we cannot use the
  183:     %% erlang:memory/0 implementation. The crashdump implementation
  184:     %% is a pure C implementation inspecting all allocator instances
  185:     %% after the system has been blocked (erts_memory() in erl_alloc.c).
  186:     %%
  187:     %% Since we got two implementations, modifications can easily
  188:     %% cause them to produce different results.
  189:     %%
  190:     %% erts_debug:get_internal_state(memory) blocks the system and
  191:     %% execute the same code as the crash dump writing uses.
  192:     %%
  193: 
  194:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  195:     %% Use a large heap size on the controlling process in
  196:     %% order to avoid changes in its heap size during
  197:     %% comparisons.
  198:     MinHeapSize = process_flag(min_heap_size, 1024*1024), 
  199:     Prio = process_flag(priority, max),
  200:     try
  201: 	erlang:memory(), %% first call will init stat atoms
  202: 	garbage_collect(), %% blow up heap
  203: 	memory_test(Config)
  204:     catch
  205: 	error:notsup -> {skipped, "erlang:memory() not supported"}
  206:     after
  207: 	process_flag(min_heap_size, MinHeapSize),
  208: 	process_flag(priority, Prio),
  209: 	catch erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false)
  210:     end.
  211: 
  212: memory_test(_Config) ->
  213: 
  214:     MWs = spawn_mem_workers(),
  215: 
  216:     DPs = mem_workers_call(MWs,
  217: 			   fun () ->
  218: 				   mapn(fun (_) ->
  219: 						spawn(fun () ->
  220: 							      receive
  221: 							      after infinity ->
  222: 								      ok
  223: 							      end
  224: 						      end)
  225: 					end,
  226: 					1000 div erlang:system_info(schedulers_online))
  227: 			   end, []),
  228:     cmp_memory(MWs, "spawn procs"),
  229: 
  230:     Ps = lists:flatten(DPs),
  231: 
  232:     mem_workers_call(MWs, 
  233: 		     fun () ->
  234: 			     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> link(P) end, Ps)
  235: 		     end, []),
  236:     cmp_memory(MWs, "link procs"),
  237:     mem_workers_call(MWs,
  238: 		     fun () ->
  239: 			     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> unlink(P) end, Ps)
  240: 		     end, []),
  241:     cmp_memory(MWs, "unlink procs"),
  242: 
  243:     mem_workers_call(MWs, 
  244: 		     fun () ->
  245: 			     lists:foreach(
  246: 			       fun (P) ->
  247: 				       Tmr = erlang:start_timer(1 bsl 34,
  248: 								P,
  249: 								hello),
  250: 				       Tmrs = case get('BIF_TMRS') of
  251: 						  undefined -> [];
  252: 						  Rs -> Rs
  253: 					      end,
  254: 				       true = is_reference(Tmr),
  255: 				       put('BIF_TMRS', [Tmr|Tmrs])
  256: 			       end, Ps)
  257: 		     end, []),
  258:     cmp_memory(MWs, "start BIF timer procs"),
  259: 
  260:     mem_workers_call(MWs, 
  261: 		     fun () ->
  262: 			     lists:foreach(fun (Tmr) ->
  263: 						   true = is_reference(Tmr),
  264: 						   true = is_integer(erlang:cancel_timer(Tmr))
  265: 					   end, get('BIF_TMRS')),
  266: 			     put('BIF_TMRS', undefined),
  267: 			     garbage_collect()
  268: 		     end, []),
  269:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(wait, deallocations),
  270:     cmp_memory(MWs, "cancel BIF timer procs"),
  271: 
  272:     DMs = mem_workers_call(MWs,
  273: 			   fun () ->
  274: 				   lists:map(fun (P) ->
  275: 						     monitor(process, P)
  276: 					     end, Ps)
  277: 			   end, []),
  278:     cmp_memory(MWs, "monitor procs"),
  279:     Ms = lists:flatten(DMs),
  280:     mem_workers_call(MWs,
  281: 		     fun () ->
  282: 			     lists:foreach(fun (M) ->
  283: 						   demonitor(M)
  284: 					   end, Ms)
  285: 		     end, []),
  286:     cmp_memory(MWs, "demonitor procs"),
  287: 
  288:     mem_workers_call(MWs,
  289: 		     fun () ->
  290: 			     lists:foreach(fun (P) ->
  291: 						   P ! {a, "message", make_ref()}
  292: 					   end, Ps)
  293: 		     end, []),
  294:     cmp_memory(MWs, "message procs"),
  295: 
  296:     mem_workers_call(MWs,
  297: 		     fun () ->
  298: 			     Mons = lists:map(fun (P) ->
  299: 						      exit(P, kill),
  300: 						      monitor(process, P)
  301: 					      end,
  302: 					      Ps),
  303: 			     lists:foreach(fun (Mon) ->
  304: 						   receive
  305: 						       {'DOWN', Mon, _, _, _} -> ok
  306: 						   end
  307: 					   end,
  308: 					   Mons)
  309: 		     end, []),
  310:     cmp_memory(MWs, "kill procs"),
  311: 
  312:     mem_workers_call(MWs,
  313: 		     fun () ->
  314: 			     put(binary_data,
  315: 				 mapn(fun (_) -> list_to_binary(lists:duplicate(256,$?)) end, 100))
  316: 		     end, []),
  317: 
  318:     cmp_memory(MWs, "store binary data"),
  319: 
  320:     mem_workers_call(MWs,
  321: 		     fun () ->
  322: 			     put(binary_data, false),
  323: 			     garbage_collect()
  324: 		     end, []),
  325:     cmp_memory(MWs, "release binary data"),
  326: 
  327:     mem_workers_call(MWs,
  328: 		     fun () ->
  329: 			     _ = list_to_atom("an ugly atom "++integer_to_list(erlang:system_info(scheduler_id))),
  330: 			     _ = list_to_atom("another ugly atom "++integer_to_list(erlang:system_info(scheduler_id))),
  331: 			     _ = list_to_atom("yet another ugly atom "++integer_to_list(erlang:system_info(scheduler_id)))
  332: 		     end, []),
  333:     cmp_memory(MWs, "new atoms"),
  334: 
  335: 
  336:     mem_workers_call(MWs,
  337: 		     fun () ->
  338: 			     T = ets:new(?MODULE, []),
  339: 			     ets:insert(T, {gurka, lists:seq(1,10000)}),
  340: 			     ets:insert(T, {banan, lists:seq(1,1024)}),
  341: 			     ets:insert(T, {appelsin, make_ref()}),
  342: 			     put(ets_id, T)
  343: 		     end, []),
  344:     cmp_memory(MWs, "store ets data"),
  345: 
  346:     mem_workers_call(MWs,
  347: 		     fun () ->
  348: 			     ets:delete(get(ets_id)),
  349: 			     put(ets_id, false)
  350: 		     end, []),
  351:     cmp_memory(MWs, "remove ets data"),
  352: 
  353:     lists:foreach(fun (MW) ->
  354: 			  unlink(MW),
  355: 			  Mon = monitor(process, MW),
  356: 			  exit(MW, kill),
  357: 			  receive
  358: 			      {'DOWN', Mon, _, _, _} -> ok
  359: 			  end
  360: 		  end, MWs),
  361:     ok.
  362: 
  363: mem_worker() ->
  364:     receive
  365: 	{call, From, Fun, Args} ->
  366: 	    From ! {reply, self(), apply(Fun, Args)},
  367: 	    mem_worker();
  368: 	{cast, _From, Fun, Args} ->
  369: 	    apply(Fun, Args),
  370: 	    mem_worker()
  371:     end.
  372: 
  373: mem_workers_call(MWs, Fun, Args) ->
  374:     lists:foreach(fun (MW) ->
  375:                           MW ! {call, self(), Fun, Args}
  376:                   end, MWs),
  377:     lists:map(fun (MW) ->
  378:                       receive
  379:                           {reply, MW, Res} ->
  380:                               Res
  381:                       end
  382:               end, MWs).
  383: 
  384: spawn_mem_workers() ->
  385:     spawn_mem_workers(erlang:system_info(schedulers_online)).
  386: 
  387: spawn_mem_workers(0) ->
  388:     [];
  389: spawn_mem_workers(N) ->
  390:     [spawn_opt(fun () -> mem_worker() end,
  391: 	       [{scheduler, N rem erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) + 1},
  392: 		link]) | spawn_mem_workers(N-1)].
  393: 
  394: 
  395: mem_get(X, Mem) ->
  396:     case lists:keyfind(X, 1, Mem) of
  397: 	{X, Val} -> Val;
  398: 	false -> false
  399:     end.
  400: 
  401: cmp_memory(What, Mem1, Mem2, 1) ->
  402:     R1 = mem_get(What, Mem1),
  403:     R2 = mem_get(What, Mem2),
  404:     true = R1 == R2;
  405: cmp_memory(What, Mem1, Mem2, RelDiff) ->
  406:     %% We allow RealDiff diff
  407:     R1 = mem_get(What, Mem1),
  408:     R2 = mem_get(What, Mem2),
  409:     case R1 == R2 of
  410: 	true ->
  411: 	    ok;
  412: 	false ->
  413: 	    case R1 > R2 of
  414: 		true ->
  415: 		    true = R2*RelDiff > R1;
  416: 		false ->
  417: 		    true = R1*RelDiff > R2
  418: 	    end
  419:     end.
  420: 
  421: pos_int(Val) when Val >= 0 ->
  422:     Val;
  423: pos_int(Val) ->
  424:     exit({not_pos_int, Val}).
  425: 
  426: check_sane_memory(Mem) ->
  427:     Tot = pos_int(mem_get(total, Mem)),
  428:     Proc = pos_int(mem_get(processes, Mem)),
  429:     ProcUsed = pos_int(mem_get(processes_used, Mem)),
  430:     Sys = pos_int(mem_get(system, Mem)),
  431:     Atom = pos_int(mem_get(atom, Mem)),
  432:     AtomUsed = pos_int(mem_get(atom_used, Mem)),
  433:     Bin = pos_int(mem_get(binary, Mem)),
  434:     Code = pos_int(mem_get(code, Mem)),
  435:     Ets = pos_int(mem_get(ets, Mem)),
  436: 
  437:     Tot = Proc + Sys,
  438:     true = Sys > Atom + Bin + Code + Ets,
  439:     true = Proc >= ProcUsed,
  440:     true = Atom >= AtomUsed,
  441: 
  442:     case mem_get(maximum, Mem) of
  443: 	false -> ok;
  444: 	Max -> true = pos_int(Max) >= Tot
  445:     end,
  446:     ok.
  447: 
  448: cmp_memory(MWs, Str) ->
  449:     erlang:display(Str),
  450:     lists:foreach(fun (MW) -> garbage_collect(MW) end, MWs),
  451:     garbage_collect(),
  452:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(wait, deallocations),
  453: 
  454:     retry(3, fun() ->
  455:                      EDM = erts_debug:get_internal_state(memory),
  456:                      EM = erlang:memory(),
  457: 
  458:                      io:format("~s:~n"
  459:                                "erlang:memory() = ~p~n"
  460:                                "crash dump memory = ~p~n",
  461:                                [Str, EM, EDM]),
  462: 
  463:                      check_sane_memory(EM),
  464:                      check_sane_memory(EDM),
  465: 
  466:                      %% We expect these to always give us exactly the same result
  467: 
  468:                      cmp_memory(atom, EM, EDM, 1),
  469:                      cmp_memory(atom_used, EM, EDM, 1),
  470:                      cmp_memory(binary, EM, EDM, 1),
  471:                      cmp_memory(code, EM, EDM, 1),
  472:                      cmp_memory(ets, EM, EDM, 1),
  473: 
  474:                      %% Total, processes, processes_used, and system will seldom
  475:                      %% give us exactly the same result since the two readings
  476:                      %% aren't taken atomically.
  477:                      %%
  478:                      %% Torerance is scaled according to the number of schedulers
  479:                      %% to match spawn_mem_workers.
  480: 
  481:                      Tolerance = 1.05 + 0.01 * erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
  482: 
  483:                      cmp_memory(total, EM, EDM, Tolerance),
  484:                      cmp_memory(processes, EM, EDM, Tolerance),
  485:                      cmp_memory(processes_used, EM, EDM, Tolerance),
  486:                      cmp_memory(system, EM, EDM, Tolerance)
  487:              end),
  488: 
  489:     ok.
  490:     
  491: retry(N, Fun) ->
  492:     try Fun()
  493:     catch
  494:         error:Error:Stack when N > 1 ->
  495:             io:format("Test failed: ~p\nat: ~p\nRetry max ~p more times\n",
  496:                       [Error, Stack, N-1]),
  497:             retry(N-1, Fun)
  498:     end.
  499: 
  500: mapn(_Fun, 0) ->
  501:     [];
  502: mapn(Fun, N) ->
  503:     [Fun(N) | mapn(Fun, N-1)].
  504: 
  505: ets_count(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  506:     [ets_count_do([Type | Named])
  507:      || Type <- [set, bag, duplicate_bag, ordered_set],
  508:         Named <- [[named_table], []]
  509:     ],
  510:     ok.
  511: 
  512: ets_count_do(Opts) ->
  513:     Before = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  514:     T = ets:new(?MODULE, Opts),
  515:     After = erlang:system_info(ets_count),
  516:     After = Before + 1,
  517:     ets:delete(T),
  518:     Before = erlang:system_info(ets_count).
  519: 
  520: 
  521: %% Verify system_info(ets_limit) reflects max ETS table settings.
  522: ets_limit(Config0) when is_list(Config0) ->
  523:     true = is_integer(get_ets_limit(0)),
  524:     12345 = get_ets_limit(12345),
  525:     ok.
  526: 
  527: get_ets_limit(EtsMax) ->
  528:     Envs = case EtsMax of
  529:                0 -> [];
  530:                _ -> ["-env", "ERL_MAX_ETS_TABLES", integer_to_list(EtsMax)]
  531:            end,
  532:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(Envs),
  533:     Res = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [ets_limit]),
  534:     peer:stop(Peer),
  535:     Res.
  536: 
  537: 
  538: %% Verify system_info(atom_limit) reflects max atoms settings
  539: %% (using " +t").
  540: atom_limit(Config0) when is_list(Config0) ->
  541:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+t", "2186042"]),
  542:     2186042 = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [atom_limit]),
  543:     peer:stop(Peer).
  544: 
  545: %% Verify that system_info(atom_count) works.
  546: atom_count(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  547:     Limit = erlang:system_info(atom_limit),
  548:     Count1 = erlang:system_info(atom_count),
  549:     _ = list_to_atom(integer_to_list(erlang:unique_integer())),
  550:     Count2 = erlang:system_info(atom_count),
  551:     true = Limit >= Count2,
  552:     true = Count2 > Count1,
  553:     ok.
  554: 
  555: 
  556: system_logger(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  557: 
  558:     TC = self(),
  559: 
  560:     ok = error_logger:add_report_handler(?MODULE, [TC]),
  561: 
  562:     generate_log_event(),
  563: 
  564:     flush(1, report_handler),
  565: 
  566:     Initial = erlang:system_info(system_logger),
  567: 
  568:     {Logger,_} = spawn_monitor(fun F() -> receive M -> TC ! {system_logger,M}, F() end end),
  569: 
  570:     Initial = erlang:system_flag(system_logger, Logger),
  571:     Logger = erlang:system_info(system_logger),
  572: 
  573:     generate_log_event(),
  574:     flush(1, system_logger),
  575: 
  576:     Logger = erlang:system_flag(system_logger, Logger),
  577: 
  578:     generate_log_event(),
  579:     flush(1, system_logger),
  580: 
  581:     exit(Logger, die),
  582:     receive {'DOWN',_,_,_,_} -> ok end,
  583: 
  584:     generate_log_event(),
  585:     flush(1, report_handler),
  586: 
  587:     logger = erlang:system_info(system_logger),
  588: 
  589:     logger = erlang:system_flag(system_logger, undefined),
  590:     generate_log_event(),
  591:     flush(),
  592: 
  593:     undefined = erlang:system_flag(system_logger, Initial),
  594: 
  595:     ok.
  596: 
  597: flush() ->
  598:     receive
  599:         M ->
  600:             ct:fail({unexpected_message, M})
  601:     after 0 ->
  602:             ok
  603:     end.
  604: 
  605: flush(0, _Pat) ->
  606:     flush();
  607: flush(Cnt, Pat) ->
  608:     receive
  609:         M when element(1,M) =:= Pat ->
  610:             ct:log("~p",[M]),
  611:             flush(Cnt-1, Pat)
  612:     after 500 ->
  613:             ct:fail({missing, Cnt, Pat})
  614:     end.
  615: 
  616: generate_log_event() ->
  617:     {_Pid, Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() -> ok = nok end),
  618:     receive {'DOWN', Ref, _, _, _} -> ok end.
  619: 
  620: init([To]) ->
  621:     {ok, To}.
  622: 
  623: handle_call(Msg, State) ->
  624:     {ok, Msg, State}.
  625: 
  626: handle_event(Event, State) ->
  627:     State ! {report_handler, Event},
  628:     {ok, State}.
  629: 
  630: 
  631: %% OTP-15909: Provoke bug that would cause VM crash
  632: %% if doing system_info(procs) when process have queued exit/down signals.
  633: procs_bug(init_per_testcase, Config) ->
  634:     %% Use single scheduler and process prio to starve monitoring processes
  635:     %% from handling their received DOWN signals.
  636:     OldSchedOnline = erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online,1),
  637:     [{schedulers_online, OldSchedOnline} | Config];
  638: procs_bug(end_per_testcase, Config) ->
  639:     erlang:system_flag(schedulers_online,
  640:                        proplists:get_value(schedulers_online, Config)),
  641:     ok.
  642: 
  643: procs_bug(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  644:     {Monee,_} = spawn_opt(fun () -> receive die -> ok end end,
  645:                          [monitor,{priority,max}]),
  646:     Papa = self(),
  647:     Pids = [begin
  648:                 P = spawn_opt(fun () ->
  649:                                       erlang:monitor(process, Monee),
  650:                                       Papa ! {self(),ready},
  651:                                       receive "nada" -> no end
  652:                               end,
  653:                               [link, {priority,normal}]),
  654:                 {P, ready} = receive M -> M end,
  655:                 P
  656:             end
  657:             || _ <- lists:seq(1,10)],
  658:     process_flag(priority,high),
  659:     Monee ! die,
  660:     {'DOWN',_,process,Monee,normal} = receive M -> M end,
  661: 
  662:     %% This call did crash VM as Pids have pending DOWN signals.
  663:     erlang:system_info(procs),
  664:     process_flag(priority,normal),
  665:     [begin unlink(P), exit(P, kill) end || P <- Pids],
  666:     ok.
